alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 6:22PM EDT until April 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produce the heavy rainfall has moved out of the advisory area. However, rainfall amounts between 1 and 3 inches have fallen over this area. This amount of rainfall will take sometime to drain away. Therefore, the Flood advisory will remain in effect until 730 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Miramar, Miami Gardens, Doral, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Pennsuco, Intersection Krome And U.S. 27, Palm Springs North, Country Club and Miami International Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
